title: After a year of world records, heatwaves and floods continue to rage across the planet
summary: All continents are experiencing or have recently experienced episodes of extreme heat, drought or torrential rain. These are direct effects of human-induced climate change, exacerbated by the El Niño phenomenon.

title: Macron accepts PM's resignation, government shifts to caretaker role
summary: President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday accepted the resignation of Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's government, which will now remain only in a caretaker capacity.

title: Paris airport staff call off pre-Olympics strike
summary: Unions had called for a stoppage on Wednesday to press for bigger Olympics bonuses and staff recruitment. They announced on Tuesday they had reached a deal on bonuses.

title: French Rugby scandal: 'There will be a before and after Mendoza,' promises Federation President
summary: Following the events in Argentina, where Melvyn Jaminet made racist remarks and Hugo Auradou and Oscar Jegou were charged with 'aggravated rape,' Florian Grill has announced that he intends to increase punishments in the event of misconduct.

title: Musk to move X and SpaceX headquarters from California to Texas over transgender law
summary: The multi-billionaire said Tuesday he plans on moving SpaceX from Hawthorne to Starbase while X will move to Austin from San Francisco. He called a new law signed Monday by California's Governor that bars school districts from requiring staff to notify parents of their child’s gender identification change the 'final straw.'

title: Watch: Kylian Mbappé presented to 80,000 Real Madrid fans
summary: Mbappé donned the white shirt and gave his first speech at the Santiago-Bernabéu stadium on July 16.

title: Musk and Thiel put their fortunes and networks to work for Trump and Vance
summary: The two Silicon Valley billionaires have launched a vast fundraising drive to finance the Republican candidate's campaign.

title: Six killed in rare Oman attack claimed by Islamic State group
summary: The jihadist group said three of its fighters were behind the shootings that targeted 'Shiites practicing their annual rituals' on the occasion of the holy mourning period of Ashura.

title: Trump assassination attempt: On social media, the shooter's elusive background fuels conspiracies
summary: The assassination attempt on the former US president, who is running for re-election, has triggered an avalanche of mostly wild speculation.

title: New Caledonia's economy collapses after two months of insurrection
summary: Already nearly bankrupt at the start of 2024, the New Caledonian government is facing massive unemployment caused by the destruction of businesses, shops and public infrastructure since the insurrection began on May 13.

title: What are the powers of a caretaker government in France?
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's government could remain in office for an indefinite period of time to handle day-to-day affairs, with restricted powers, until President Emmanuel Macron names a new prime minister.

title: US Senator Bob Menendez found guilty on all counts in corruption trial
summary: The 70-year-old politician was convicted on Tuesday of a number of corrupt acts including taking bribes including gold bars, a luxury car and cash and acting as a foreign agent for the Egyptian government.

title: Nepal, the world champion of political instability
summary: The small Himalayan republic has just appointed its 14th prime minister in 15 years, illustrating a culture of purely transactional public affairs as a growing number of unemployed young people leave the country.

title: Trump assassination attempt: Secret Service and local law enforcement trade blame
summary: The Secret Service believes that it was only responsible for the inner perimeter of the Republican rally on July 13 in Butler, Pennsylvania, and not for the outer area, where the shooter was positioned, which was entrusted to the local police.

title: Malta's Metsola re-elected as EU Parliament president
summary: Roberta Metsola has overwhelmingly won another two-and-a-half-year mandate after receiving 562 out of 699 MEP votes.

title: Rugby international Jaminet under investigation over racist remarks
summary: Prosecutors said they had opened an investigation after the player was filmed saying he wanted to attack Arabs.

title: Moroccan academia mobilizes against normalization with Israel
summary: More and more students and teachers are calling for a halt to the partnerships forged by part of the Moroccan academic world with Israeli universities.

title: J.D. Vance, Donald Trump's running mate: A student of Trumpism and potential heir
summary: The 39-year-old senator from Ohio was sworn in on Monday, the first day of the Republican convention in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. While he brings youth to the former president's ticket, he does not allow him to broaden his base.

title: Murder of a Kazakh opposition journalist in Kyiv strains relations between Ukraine and Kazakhstan
summary: Aidos Sadykov's murder was carried out by two Kazakh citizens, possibly linked to Kazakhstan's security services.
